sentence.Network_en: Breathe out and ease your knees in toward your chest.
sentence.Network_cn: 呼气，膝部放松向胸部靠拢。

sentence.Network_en: Place your hands on the small of your back and breathe in.
Hold your breath for a count of five, then slowly breathe out.
sentence.Network_cn: 屏住气息数五下，然后慢慢地呼气。

jx.jx_en_mean: relax after being frightened or tense about something
jx.jx_cn_mean: （害怕，紧张之后）放松，放下心来

lj.lj_ly: she wouldn't breathe freely again until she was airborne.
lj.lj_ls: 直到飞机起飞以后她才松了口气。

jx.jx_en_mean: fill with enthusiasm and energy; reinvigorate

lj.lj_ly: the Prime Minister would breathe new life into his party.
lj.lj_ls: 总理会为他的政党注入新的活力。

jx.jx_en_mean: To threaten by proximity, especially by pursuing closely.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 威胁：威胁，尤指逼近、紧追不放地威胁

jx.jx_en_mean: To watch or monitor closely, often annoyingly
jx.jx_cn_mean: 严密监视：严密地监视，常指令人恼恨地

lj.lj_ly: The boss was breathing down my neck all morning.
lj.lj_ls: 老板整个上午都死死地盯着我

jx.jx_en_mean: To be relaxed or relieved, especially after a period of tension.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 松一口气，放下心来：尤指一段时间的紧张后放松或解脱

phrase.cizu_name: breathe easily 或 breathe easy  或 breathe freely

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English  (in the sense 'exhale, steam'): from breath

encyclopedia.content: Breathe是Taylor Swift 在专辑《Fearless》中的一首与Colbie Caillat合唱的美国抒情风格的歌曲。

entry.def: When people or animals breathe, they take air into their lungs and let it out again. When they breathe smoke or a particular kind of air, they take it into their lungs and let it out again as they breathe.

example.ex: He stood there breathing deeply and evenly...
example.tran: 他站在那儿均匀地深呼吸。

entry.def: If someone breathes something, they say it very quietly.
If you do not breathe a word about something, you say nothing about it, because it is a secret.

example.ex: He never breathed a word about our conversation.
example.tran: 关于我们的谈话他只字未提。

entry.tran: 将（生气、信心或兴奋）注入；为…带来
entry.def: If someone breathes life, confidence, or excitement into something, they improve it by adding this quality.

example.ex: It is the readers who breathe life into a newspaper with their letters.
example.tran: 是读者通过来信给报纸带来了生气。

entry.def: If you let wine breathe, you open the bottle to allow the air to get in and improve its flavour before you drink it.

example.ex: Red wines should be allowed to 'breathe' if possible before drinking.
example.tran: 如果可能的话，在饮用红酒前应该先开瓶透透气。

entry.def: When someone breathes their last, they die.

means.word_mean: 1. draw air into, and expel out of, the lungs;

sentences.sentence: "I can breathe better when the air is clean"
"He breathed new life into the old house"

means.word_mean: 4. allow the passage of air through;

sentences.sentence: "Our new synthetic fabric breathes and is perfect for summer wear"

means.word_mean: 7. take a short break from one's activities in order to relax
8. reach full flavor by absorbing air and being let to stand after having been uncorked;

sentences.sentence: "This rare Bordeaux must be allowed to breathe for at least 2 hours"

auth_sentence.content: Even then, she is basically struggling to breathe.
auth_sentence.res_content: Even then, she is basically struggling to breathe.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Even then, she is basically struggling to breathe.

auth_sentence.content: They were so close I almost forgot to breathe.
auth_sentence.res_content: They were so close I almost forgot to breathe.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: They were so close I almost forgot to breathe.

auth_sentence.content: There won't be any space to breathe anymore.
auth_sentence.res_content: There won't be any space to breathe anymore.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: There won't be any space to breathe anymore.

Sentence.sentence: Some restaurants are modifying the recipes (菜谱) of British dishes to breathe new life into the classics, while others are using better quality ingredients but remaining true to British traditions and tastes.
The supervisor of the laboratory is beginning to get headaches and dizzy spells because she says it's dangerous to breathe some of the chemical smoke there.
You breathe less when you sleep, so you get less oxygen.

sentences.en: He has gone; you can breathe again.
sentences.cn: 他已经走了, 你可以松口气了。

sentences.en: They came out of the tunnel and thankfully breathed the fresh air.
sentences.cn: 他们走出地道, 贪婪地吸着新鲜空气。

sentences.en: Don't worry, I wouldn't breathe a word of your secret.
sentences.cn: 别担心, 我不会泄漏你的秘密。

jushi.english: The doctor told Charlie to breathe deeply.
The danger is over; we can breathe again now.
jushi.chinese: 危险已经过去,我们现在可以放下心来了。

jushi.english: The elephant was still breathing, so we knew it was still alive.
jushi.chinese: 那头大象仍在呼吸,所以我们知道它仍然活着。
